Prompting Name: ITP/R Test Report Gaseous Suppression System (V.240521)

Name: Attach Photos/Comments below if any issues & send report to Builder
Verify correct type, spacing and elevation of installed pipe supports and hangers
Acceptance Criteria: Installed to Approved Drawings
Installation inspection of pipes and nozzle droppers/risers
Acceptance Criteria: Installed to Approved Drawings
All dirt traps must be capped and all pops temporarily plugged
Acceptance Criteria: Installed to Approved Drawings
Perform Pneumatic leak test of pipework in accordance with approved Test procedure and SWMS. Gradually apply pressure increments of 100 kPa for 15 minute holds
Acceptance Criteria: Pressure drop should not exceed 20% of 300 kPa for 10-mins
Installation of Cylinders, Manifolds, Valves, Actuation, Discharge Hoses & Nozzles
Cycinders shall be adequately mounted and suitably supported according to approved installation plan
Acceptance Criteria: Installed to Approved Drawings, AS 14520.1-2009 Clause 8.2.3.12a
Discharge manifolds and valves shall be mounted and adequately supported
Acceptance Criteria: Installed to Approved Drawings, AS 14520.1-2009 Clause 6.3.4
Adequate quantity, correct code and location of discharge nozzles shall be installed according to approved plan
Acceptance Criteria: Installed to Approved Drawings, AS 14520.1-2009 Clause 6.3.6.1
Detection, actuation, alarm and control systems shall be installed and tested by “DRY FIRE” contractor in accordance to relevant code/standards
Acceptance Criteria: Installed to Approved Drawings, AS 14520.1-2009 Clause 6.4.1
Client to confirm that all services penetrations and/or openings are sealed prior to the test
Acceptance Criteria: Builder Approval (Click to add signature Sign-Off below as required)
Client to confirm that all HVAC fire rated dampers including OPR Damper can be closed prior to the test
Acceptance Criteria: Builder Approval (Click to add signature Sign-Off below as required)
Perform both pressurization and depressurization fan test of the room and using the software program, confirm that holding time is equal or more than the required 10 minutes
Acceptance Criteria: Relief Damper Installed is sufficient
Prepare full test report of each enclosure demonstrating the level of compliance achieved
Enclosure PASSED the hold time & venting requirements
Prior to start of any test, ensure all extinguishant storage container release mechanism are disabled or removed

Verify and confirm compliance to the approved design of distribution piping system, discharge nozzle sizes & orientations, storage containers quantity & locations and warning signs & notices locations
Acceptance Criteria: Installed to Approved Drawings

With the operation of fire alarm system, verify and confirm operation of audible & visual alarms, plant shutdown interface, time delay & release mechanism activation/30s time delay / solenoid operated/ audible visual Alarm
Acceptance Criteria: 30s time delay, solenoid operated , Audible/visual alarm operated
Simulate discharge pressure switch operation and confirm gas released alarm indication at Fire Suppression Panel
After completion of system functional test, reset and reconnect all release mechanism onto storage container and return the system to full service condition
Acceptance Criteria: Builder Approval (Click to add signature Sign-Off below as required)
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
FINAL - Pass when happy to proceed with work(s) (Any issues please comment below)
Attach Photos/Comments below if any issues & send report to Builder
Verify correct type, spacing and elevation of installed pipe supports and hangers
Acceptance Criteria: Installed to Approved Drawings
Installation inspection of trunk mains and range pipes
Acceptance Criteria: Installed to Approved Drawings
All dirt traps must be capped and all pops temporarily plugged
Acceptance Criteria: Installed to Approved Drawings
Inspection of installed sprinkler heads & baffle plates and flexible droppers
Perform Pneumatic leak test of pipework to ensure no loose joints or open pipe ends

Perform Hydrostatic Testing of pipework. Gradually apply pressure increments of 500 kPa for 15 minute holds until test pressure of 1400 kPa or 400 kPa above maximum static working pressure of the system is achieved and hold for 2-hours
Installation of Pre-Action Valve Sets & Ancillary Equipment
Installation inspection of pre-action valve sets and ancillary equipment to ensure completeness, correct location, mounting
Verify installation of alarm devices (e.g. DBA pressure/flow switch, low pressure switch) and solenoid valve for correct type and rating and proper interface connections to Fire Indicator Panel (FIP)

Perform a trip test on each pre-action valve by opening the alarm test ball valve and check operation of water motor alarm. Confirm operation of DBA pressure switch with correct indication at fire indicator panel
Acceptance Criteria: Refer AS 2118.1-2006 Clause 15.4b, DBA -3 mins
Initiate single or double interlock release activation and check  operation of water motor alarm, DBA pressure switch and correct indication at fire indicator panel
Acceptance Criteria: Refer AS 2118.1-2006 Clause 15.4b, operational confirmation
Record cut-in / cut-out pressure of air supply compressor and time to recharge the system pressure
Acceptance Criteria: Refer AS 2118.1-2006 Clause 15.4b, Time to recharge 30 mins
Reinstate system and ensure valves are secured in its intended position, alarm and monitoring devices are in operational mode and system in ready to operate condition
Works completed to specification/drawings - Attach photos of work below
FINAL - Pass when happy to proceed with work(s) (Any issues please comment below)

Guidelines: Fire Sprinkler Systems – –AS:2118.1 2017- 1600kPa or 400kPa above the maximum static pressure for a duration of 2 hours (Check notes on Construction Drawing for nominated test pressure)
Fire Hydrant Systems (Low Rise) – 1700kPa or 15 times the design pressure for a duration of 2 hours (Check notes on Construction Drawing for nominated test pressure)

Fire Hydrant Systems (High Rise) – 1050kPa at the highest hydrant in the pressure stage being tested If pressure reading is being taken at the booster, determine the height difference in metres between the top hydrant and the booster and add 10kPa per metre of static pressure to this figure with a minimum test pressure of 1700kPa If in doubt please seek clarification from the Construction Supervisor or the Design Manager
Rough In Only OR Rough In & Fit Off Together
Fit Off (if required ie if not covered by the above section)

Guidelines: Fire Sprinkler Systems – 1400kPa or 400kPa above the maximum static pressure for a duration of 2 hours (Check notes on Construction Drawing for nominated test pressure)
Fire Hydrant Systems (Low Rise) – 1700kPa or 15 times the design pressure for a duration of 2 hours (Check notes on Construction Drawing for nominated test pressure)

Fire Hydrant Systems (High Rise) – 1050kPa at the highest hydrant in the pressure stage being tested If pressure reading is being taken at the booster, determine the height difference in metres between the top hydrant and the booster and add 10kPa per metre of static pressure to this figure with a minimum test pressure of 1700kPa If in doubt please seek clarification from the Construction Supervisor or the Design Manager
Rough In Only OR Rough In & Fit Off Together
Fit Off (if required ie if not covered by the above section)
